internships

National Instruments | Summer 2014

This summer I am creating a Linux kernel driver for USB3 Vision support. My goal is to increase the performance of the existing implementation by using this new driver and bypassing user libraries. When the project is complete, NI plans to open-source this code to the Linux and machine vision community.

Knox Technology | Summer and Fall 2013

I designed and implemented new features, remediated defects, and reviewed and tested code for a web-based hiring application. I developed code for various aspects of the product, including the user interface, client and server-side validation, database queries, and integrations with third-party systems.

In the fall I transitioned to a smaller role with the Quality Assurance team. I used my knowledge of the application to pinpoint potential issues with new features, verifying the correctness of code prior to its release.

relativity | A web-based puzzle game

This HTML5/JS game was created for Global Game Jam 2014 by a team of four developers and a musician. The goal was to create a game that was inspired by the theme, "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are."

Relativity allows the user to collect spirit orbs, which cause a shift in perspective. Every time the user collects an orb, he or she leaves behind the previous orb and no longer sees the walls and orbs of the current color.

The objective is to complete levels as efficiently as possible by switching orbs the fewest number of times.

My main contribution to the project was level design and creation.

Play

Pintos | An instructional operating system created at Stanford

I worked on a team of four to implement key features in the OS, including priority scheduling and donation, argument passing, system calls, demand paging, stack growth, indexed and extensible files, and subdirectories.

AES-128 | An encryption algorithm in Java

I created a Java implementation of AES-128 as a solo project for a Computer Security class.
